Package org.uma.evolver.algorithm.base.nsgaii.parameterspace

Class NSGAIIBinaryParameterSpace

java.lang.Object
org.uma.evolver.parameter.ParameterSpace
org.uma.evolver.algorithm.base.nsgaii.parameterspace.NSGAIICommonParameterSpace<org.uma.jmetal.solution.binarysolution.BinarySolution>
org.uma.evolver.algorithm.base.nsgaii.parameterspace.NSGAIIBinaryParameterSpace
public class NSGAIIBinaryParameterSpace extends NSGAIICommonParameterSpace<org.uma.jmetal.solution.binarysolution.BinarySolution>
Parameter space for NSGA-II algorithm variants using binary-coded solutions.

This class extends NSGAIICommonParameterSpace and adds parameters specific to binary-coded problems, including bit-flip mutation and single-point crossover operators.

It defines and configures all relevant parameters for the NSGA-II algorithm when working with BinarySolution representations.

Example usage: 


 NSGAIIBinaryParameterSpace parameterSpace = new NSGAIIBinaryParameterSpace();
 // Configure parameters as needed
Author:
Antonio J. Nebro

  • Method Details

    • createInstance

      public NSGAIIBinaryParameterSpace createInstance()
      Description copied from class: ParameterSpace
      Creates and configures a new instance of this parameter space.

      This method is part of the prototype pattern, allowing parameter spaces to be cloned with the same configuration. Implementations should return a new instance of the concrete parameter space class with the same parameter configuration.

      Example implementation: 

       @Override
 public ParameterSpace createInstance() {
     return new MyParameterSpace();
 }

      Specified by:
      createInstance in class ParameterSpace
      Returns:
      a new instance of this parameter space

    • setParameterSpace

      protected void setParameterSpace()
      Defines and adds all parameters specific to binary-coded NSGA-II to the parameter space.

      This method calls super.setParameterSpace() and then adds binary-specific parameters, including:

      • Single-point crossover with configurable probability
      • Bit-flip mutation with configurable probability factor
      • Number of bits in a solution (non-configurable, must be set before use)
      Overrides:
      setParameterSpace in class NSGAIICommonParameterSpace<org.uma.jmetal.solution.binarysolution.BinarySolution>

    • setParameterRelationships

      protected void setParameterRelationships()
      Establishes relationships and dependencies between parameters specific to binary-coded NSGA-II.

      This method calls super.setParameterRelationships() and then adds relationships for binary-specific parameters, connecting crossover and mutation operators with their respective parameters.

      Overrides:
      setParameterRelationships in class NSGAIICommonParameterSpace<org.uma.jmetal.solution.binarysolution.BinarySolution>
